title: Lake Baikal
summary: Lake Baikal (/baɪˈkɑːl, -ˈkæl/;[3] Russian: Oзеро Байкал, romanized: Ozero Baykal [ˈozʲɪrə bɐjˈkaɫ]; Buryat: Байгал далай, romanized: Baigal dalai;[4] Mongolian: Байгал нуур, romanized: Baigal nuur) is a rift lake located in Russia situated in southern Siberia between the federal subjects of Irkutsk Oblast to the northwest and Buryatia to the southeast.
